testcase.name: Correct sequence of the Months
testcase.summary: This test shall verify if system correctly displays every months of the year on the correct sequence.
testcase.preconditions: Log in

step.actions: Access Valid system with admin/regular user
step.expectedresults: The system is successfully acessed
The Calendar page is displayed
The current month is displayed on calendar and its title has the format month and year

step.actions: At the title of calendar, click on right arrow ">" to pass to the next month, until it reaches December
step.expectedresults: The ascending sequence of months is correct

step.actions: At the title of calendar, click on left arrow "<" to pass to the previous month, until it reaches January
step.expectedresults: The descending sequence of months is correct

step.actions: At the title of calendar, click on left arrow "<" to pass to the previous week, until it reaches the begging of the month

testcase.name: Verify if new campaign is correctly displayed on calendar

step.actions:
Check if the new created campaign is correctly displayed on calendar:

  • It must be displayed on calendar at Monthly mode;
  • It must be displayed on calendar at Weekly mode;
  • It must be displayed on calendar at Daily mode;

Check the results below:

  • It is correctly displayed on calendar at Monthly mode;
  • It is correctly displayed on calendar at Weekly mode;
  • It is correctly displayed on calendar at Daily mode;
  • In all cases above it is correctly displayed in the correct period of durantion

System does not enable the button and does not goes to step 6 (Schedule);

testcase.name: Check sort of Image Name column

step.expectedresults: The Library screen is displayed

step.actions: Rest the cursor over "Image Name" label, the first column
step.expectedresults: The cursor changes from an arrow icon to a hand icon
The image list is sorted

step.actions:
Check if the image list is correctly sorted:

1. If the list were previously sorted by ascending alphabetical order, it must now appears at descending alphabetical order with descending bars icon at the left side of label "Image name";

2. If the list were previously sorted by descending alphabetical order, it must now appears at ascending alphabetical order with ascending bars icon at the left side of label "Image name";
step.expectedresults:
1. The image list is correctly sorted and the correct icon appears (descending with descending bars icon)

2. The image list is correctly sorted and the correct icon appears (ascending with ascending bars icon)

The New User page is opened

step.expectedresults: The fields are filled

step.actions: Select one company and one permission
step.expectedresults: The company and the permission are selected

step.actions:
Fill the field "Email" with the following inputs, one at time:
  • Only letters, e.g. "emailfortest";
  • Letters and space, e.g. "email for test";
  • Only numbers, e.g. "123456789";
  • Numbers and space, e.g. "123 456 789";
  • Only special characteres, e.g. "@#$%¨&"
  • Space before email, e.g. "     email@test.com";
  • Space after email, e.g. "email@teste.com  ";
  • Only spaces, e.g. "         ";
  • Letter with accents, e.g. "téste@teste.çom";
  • Special characters, e.g. "%&$@gmail.com";
  • Empty field, e.g. "";
  • Valid email with space, e.g. "teste @gmail.com"
  • Only the email structure, e.g. "@.com.br"
step.expectedresults: The field is filled with each one of the possibilities listed and the test is perfomed by clicking the "New User" button

step.actions: Check if the system prevents to create the user for the listed inputs
step.expectedresults: The system prevents to create the user for the inputs

testcase.name: Verify text search filter of restricted dates
testcase.summary: This test shall verify if system searches the registered restricted dates through search filter
testcase.preconditions: Log in as admin and have created restricted dates

step.actions: Access Valid system with admin user
step.expectedresults: The system is successfully acessed
The Restricted Date page is displayed

step.actions:
Fill the text field of search with the inputs below:
  1. Existing restricted date's name with the exact format text that it has been created;
  2. Existing restricted date's name with all the letters in uppercase;
  3. Existing restricted date's name with all the letters in lowercase;
  4. Existing restricted date's name with only the firsts letters, eg. "Valid" → "Val";
  5. Existing restricted date's name with only the firsts letters in uppercase, eg. "Valid" → "VAL";
  6. Existing restricted date's name with only the firsts letters in lowercase, eg. "Valid" → "val";
  7. Any text that does not match any created restricted date's name, eg. "Inexistent1234";
  8. Text in common between two or more restricted dates's name,eg. "Valid Brazil" "Valid USA" → "Valid";
  9. Fill the field and then delete its content.
  10. Existing start date of restricted date with the exact format that it has been created;
  11. Existing end date of restricted date with the exact format that it has been created;
  12. Only day for existing start/end date of restricted date, e.g. "06";
  13. Only month for existing start/end date of restricted date, e.g. "12";
  14. Only year for existing start/end date of restricted date, e.g. "2016";
  15. Existing start/end date of restricted date with year, month and day separeted by spaces, e.g. "2016/04/25" → "2016 04 25";
  16. Existing start/end date of restricted date with year, month and day with no separetion, e.g. "2016/04/25" → "20160425".
step.expectedresults:
Check the results:
  1. The restricted date is shown in the search result;
  2. The restricted date is shown in the search result;
  3. The restricted date is shown in the search result;
  4. The restricted date is shown in the search result;
  5. The restricted date is shown in the search result;
  6. The restricted date is shown in the search result;
  7. No restricted date is shown in the search result;
  8. All the restricted dates with the text are shown in the search result;
  9. The result of search is shown and when the field's content is deleted and the List Of Restrictive Dates is displayed;
  10. All the restricted dates with this start date are shown in the search result;
  11. All the restricted dates with this end date are shown in the search result;
  12. All the restricted dates with this day are shown in the search result;
  13. All the restricted dates with this month are shown in the search result;
  14. All the restricted dates with this year are shown in the search result;
  15. No restricted date is shown in the search result;
  16. No restricted date is shown in the search result;

step.actions: Check if all the results found are consistent with the results expected
step.expectedresults: All the results are consistent

testcase.name: Reset password through Lost Password link
testcase.summary: This test case shall verify if a user can change his password in the system though Lost Password link
testcase.preconditions: To have a created user

step.actions: User clicks at "Lost Password?" in Login screen
step.expectedresults: System opens the "Lost Password?" window

step.actions: User inserts the username and email correctly on the appropriate fields
step.expectedresults: System shows the Username and Email fields filled.
The request for password change is processed and an email is sent to the user, containing a link for the insertion of a new password
Link leads to a Page to insert new Password.

step.actions: User inserts a valid new Password and Save.
step.expectedresults: System shows a success message.
The new password is successfully received

step.actions: User logs in System with new password.
step.expectedresults: The system is successfully accessed with the new password

testcase.name: Reset Password with inexistent username
testcase.summary: This test case shall verify if system prevents an user to reset a password in the system with inexistent username

step.actions: User clicks at "Lost Password?" in Login Screen
step.expectedresults: The "Lost Password?" window is opened

step.actions: User inserts an inexistent username and an available email already registered on the system on theirs respectives fields
step.expectedresults: The fields username and email are properly filled
System shows a message informing that the username is inexistent, therefore the password will not be reseted

testcase.name: Reset Password with inexistent email
testcase.summary: This test case shall verify if a user can not change their password in the system with inexistent email.

step.actions: User clicks "Lost Password?" in Login Screen.
step.expectedresults: System shows the Recover Password Form.

step.actions: User inserts the inexistent email and correct username on the appropriate fields
step.expectedresults: System shows the Username and Email fields filled.
System shows a message informing email is inexistent.

testcase.name: Reset Password with unmatching username and email

step.actions: User inserts the username and email that are not from same User.
step.expectedresults: System shows the Username and Email fields filled.
System shows a message informing username are unmatching

testcase.name: Reset Password without username

step.expectedresults: System shows the Username field empty and Email field filled.

testcase.name: Reset Password without email
testcase.summary: This test case shall verify if a user can not change their password in the system without email.

step.actions: User clicks "Lost Password?" in Login Screen.
step.expectedresults: System shows the Recover Password Form.

step.actions: User inserts the without email and with correct username on the appropriate fields
